title: Use Asset Management
content:
Your tenant can work in one or more of the following experience modes depending on the license assigned to the tenant: IT Service Management, Extended Service Management, Asset Management, and Cloud Management. Each experience mode enables user access to specific modules in the system. For information about the licenses required for each experience mode and the modules available in each experience mode, see Experience mode. 

This topic gives a brief introduction to the Asset Management experience mode and gives insights into what you can achieve with this experience mode. 

About Asset Management

The Asset Management solution helps you to manage your hardware and software assets, optimize spend, ensure compliance, and consolidate Asset Management for projects. Asset Management offers the following benefits:

  • Provide increased visibility with centralized IT asset management capabilities for software, hardware management
  • Automate asset lifecycle processes, and track contractual, financial, and inventory information for both hardware assets and software licenses
  • Native integration with Universal Discovery to retrieve the most up-to-date hardware and software data
  • Leverage out-of-the-box vendor compliance reports to efficiently manage software titles and stay on top of audits

Asset Management modules

Asset Management includes the following:

  • Service Catalog Management
  • Company Management
  • Knowledge Management
  • Service Asset and Configuration Management (SACM)
  • Software Asset Management (SAM)
  • Service Request Management
  • Contract Management
  • Idea and Proposal Management
  • Application Portfolio Management
  • Project and Program Management
  • Financial Management
  • Procurement Management
